io.foxtrot.android.sdk.state

Class RouteStateListener

  • Object
    • io.foxtrot.android.sdk.state.RouteStateListener

  • public abstract class RouteStateListener
extends Object
    Class to listen for route changed events. Whenever the route state has changed, the new route will be emitted via the onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute) callback. When a route has been finished after calling FoxtrotSDK.finishRoute(String), the next route will be emitted via the onRouteChanged(OptimizedRoute) callback if and only if there are more routes. If there are no more remaining routes, then the onAllRoutesFinished() callback will be invoked. 

     public class RouteActivity extends Activity {

   private final Handler handler = new Handler(getMainLooper());
   private final RouteStateListener routeStateListener = new RouteStateListener() {
     @Nonnull
     @Override
     public Handler getHandler() {
       return handler;
     }

     @Override
     public void onAllRoutesFinished() {
       super.onAllRoutesFinished();
       // no more routes remaining
     }

     @Override
     public void onRouteChanged(@Nonnull OptimizedRoute route) {
       super.onRouteChanged(route);
       // update view with new route
     }

   };

   @Override
   protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
     super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
     FoxtrotSDK.getInstance().registerRouteStateListener(routeStateListener);
   }

   @Override
   protected void onStop() {
     super.onStop();
     FoxtrotSDK.getInstance().unregisterRouteStateListener(routeStateListener);
   }

 }
    See Also:
    FoxtrotSDK, OptimizedRoute
